  "description": "Alaro City Development FZC is an integrated, mixed-use city planned for over 2,000 hectares in the North West Quadrant of the Lekki Free Zone. Alaro City&rsquo;s vision goes beyond alleviating what is a self-evident problem - that of stifling urban congestion and a dearth of quality housing and commercial property in Lagos and Africa as a whole.

Rather, we aim to help create the infrastructure - the living and working spaces, communities, schools, and hospitals - that will help sustain and accelerate Nigeria&rsquo;s economic growth, meet the aspirations of Africa&rsquo;s burgeoning middle classes, and serve as a catalyst for further urban development. The people in our team are multi-skilled and experts in their respective fields. They possess a unique drive, underpinned by the desire to help improve Africa&rsquo;s urban development.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Photo &amp; Video Content Associate

Job Location:&nbsp;Epe, Lagos
Employment Type: Full -Time (On-site)
Category:&nbsp;Marketing Department

Role Overview


	We are seeking a highly skilled and creative Photo &amp; Video Content Associate to lead the visual storytelling of Alaro City.
	This role combines photography, videography, video editing, and content creation to produce compelling visual assets for marketing campaigns, digital channels, events, and corporate communication.
	The ideal candidate must be versatile capable of capturing exceptional images, filming high-quality videos, editing content, and managing the full production process from concept to delivery.


Key Responsibilities
Photography:


	Capture high-quality photographs for marketing campaigns, events, corporate activities, real estate, products, lifestyle content, and project progress.
	Conduct monthly drone shoots (flyovers) to document ongoing project development.
	Retouch, edit, and manage photo assets to maintain high visual standards.
	Ensure all photography aligns with brand identity and campaign objectives.


Videography &amp; Video Production:


	Plan, film, and edit video content for campaigns, events, social media, corporate communication, interviews, and project updates.
	Create short-form and long-form videos optimized for various digital platforms.
	Capture footage for storytelling, testimonials, and behind-the-scenes coverage.
	Deliver polished video outputs including motion graphics, transitions, and sound where required.


Content Development &amp; Collaboration:


	Work closely with the Marketing &amp; Communications team to conceptualize and execute creative ideas.
	Develop content calendars for photography and video needs.
	Collaborate with designers and social media managers to ensure cohesive and impactful visual communication.
	Organize and archive all visual content for easy retrieval and future use.


Equipment &amp; Workflow Management:


	Operate and maintain photography, videography, and drone equipment.
	Ensure safe storage and proper care of all equipment.
	Manage production timelines and ensure timely delivery of all assets.


Innovation &amp; Brand Alignment:


	Stay updated on industry trends, production techniques, and editing styles to keep content fresh and competitive.
	Maintain a consistent visual tone that strengthens the brand&rsquo;s overall communication.


Requirements
Qualifications &amp; Skills:


	Minimum of 5 years of experience in photography, videography, and editing.
	Proven portfolio showcasing strong work across events, corporate, lifestyle, product, and real estate photography and videography.
	Proficient in editing software:
	
		Photo: Adobe Photoshop, Lightroom
		Video: Adobe Premiere Pro, Final Cut Pro, DaVinci Resolve (or similar)
	
	
	Drone operation experience is an added advantage.
	Strong understanding of lighting, composition, sound, and storytelling.
	Ability to multitask and manage multiple deadlines.
	Excellent communication and team collaboration abilities.
	Strong creative vision and attention to detail.
	Flexibility to work evenings, weekends, and during special events as required

title: Job Openings at FactBase Consulting Limited
content:
FactBase Consulting Limited is a medium-sized and professionally-run HR consulting firm in Lagos with a keen interest in developing young, brilliant, diligent and honest graduates to become HRM professionals starting as Management Trainees [HRM].

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Corporate Communication Manager

Job Location: Lagos 
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description 
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Assist in developing and executing an integrated corporate communication strategy, ensuring consistent and effective messaging to internal and external stakeholders.


 Experience


	B.Sc./HND in Business Administration, Mass Communications, Marketing or related disciplines.
	Minimum of eight years’ experience with at least four years’ experience in a supervisory role in a manufacturing or FMCG industry.
	A higher degree will be an added advantage.
	A relevant professional certification is a plus.


Application Closing Date: 12th December, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: factbaseconsulting@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted, please.

 

 

2.) Head of Marketing

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description (in Summary)


	Oversee the company’s marketing strategy development and implementation to grow its market share and revenue.
	Develop policies for the execution of marketing activities and ensure effective execution of marketing campaigns.


Requirements


	B.Sc./HND in Marketing, Brand Management, Business Administration or related discipline.
	Minimum of 13 years of experience with at least five years’ in a supervisory role.
	Professional certifications in (e.g., NIMN, CIMM, CMMP, etc.) will be an added advantage.
	Experience in FMCG industry is required.


Application Closing Date: 17th December, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: factbaseconsulting@gmail.com using the Job Position and preferred location as the subject of the mail.

Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted, please.

 

 

3.)  Human Resource Management Trainee

Job Location: Ajah, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	Plan, coordinate and execute various training projects for various clients;
	Plan and execute various recruitment projects.
	Plan and implement various HR consulting projects.
	Research, write and implement various HR proposals and projects.
	Participate actively in our in-house consultants' development programmes.


Major Requirements


	Degree/ HND (Minimum of 2.2/Upper Credit) in OTM, Mass Comm, Social/ Life Sciences, Humanities, Law, Educational Management, Library Science/Technology
	Age: 26 years (max).
	Comfortable skills in the MS Office Suite.
	NYSC Discharged Certificate.


Application Closing Date: 11th December, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: factbaseconsulting@gmail.com using the Job Position and preferred location as the subject of the mail.

Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted, please.

title: Job Openings at the Lamb Medical Center
content:
The Lamb Hospital is a newly established healthcare facility located in the heart of Mowe, committed to delivering quality, accessible, and compassionate medical services to the community. Founded with a vision to improve community health and well-being, The Lamb Hospital offers a range of primary and preventive healthcare services aimed at meeting the needs of individuals and families in the area. Our focus is on patient-centered care, professionalism, and health education. We are equipped with modern facilities and staffed by dedicated professionals who are passionate about making a positive impact in the lives of our patients.

We are recruiting suitable candidates to fill the following positions below:
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



1.) Medical Laboratory Scientist

Job Location: Mowe / Shimawa, Ogun
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are seeking a skilled and dedicated Medical Laboratory Scientist to join our healthcare team.
	The ideal candidate will be responsible for conducting laboratory tests, analyzing results, and ensuring accurate diagnoses to support quality patient care.


Key Responsibilities


	Perform routine and specialized laboratory tests.
	Analyze samples and interpret results.
	Ensure proper maintenance and calibration of laboratory equipment.
	Maintain accurate records and reports of test findings.
	Adhere to standard laboratory protocols and safety regulations.
	Collaborate with medical professionals for accurate diagnosis and treatment.


Requirements


	BMLS Degree from a recognized institution.
	Minimum of 3 years of relevant work experience.
	Current practicing license from the Medical Laboratory Science Council of Nigeria (MLSCN).
	Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
	Ability to work independently and within a team.


Application Closing Date: 31st December, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: thelambhospital@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

 

 

2.) Sonographer / Radiographer


Job Location: Mowe / Shimawa, Ogun

Key Responsibilities


	Conduct ultrasound examinations following physician requests and established procedures.
	Prepare and position patients for imaging while ensuring comfort and safety.
	Capture clear diagnostic images and ensure accurate documentation.
	Maintain and operate ultrasound equipment efficiently.
	Collaborate with doctors and other medical staff to support accurate diagnosis.
	Adhere to clinic policies, safety, and infection control standards.


Requirements


	Diploma or Degree in Sonography or related field.
	Proven experience in performing diagnostic ultrasound scans.
	Valid certification or license to practice as a Sonographer (where applicable).
	Strong knowledge of anatomy, physiology, and imaging protocols.
	Excellent attention to detail and image interpretation skills.
	Good communication and interpersonal skills.
	Ability to maintain professionalism and patient.


Application Closing Date: 15th December, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hospitalthelamb@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

 

 

3.) Registered Nurse

Job Location: Mowe / Shimawa, Ogun
Employment Type: Full-time

Role Description
This is a full-time on-site role for a Registered Nurse/Midwife:


	The Registered Nurse will be responsible for providing quality patient care, administering medications, collaborating with healthcare professionals, providing family planning, maternity, and midwifery services as part of the healthcare team.


Qualifications


	Relevant certification or license in midwifery
	Basic Life Support (BLS) certification
	Experience in a healthcare setting, especially in maternity care
	Family Planning, Maternity, and Midwifery skills
	Medicine and Nursing knowledge
	Strong interpersonal and communication skills
	Attention to detail and critical thinking abilities
	Ability to work effectively in a team.


Application Closing Date: 29th December, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: kingdom.lamb2023@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply
